import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.svm import SVC
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
def preprocess_data(df):
    # Fill missing values
    imputer_age = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
    imputer_embarked = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')
    df['Age'] = imputer_age.fit_transform(df[['Age']])
    df['Embarked'] = imputer_embarked.fit_transform(df[['Embarked']])
    
    # Drop unnecessary columns
    df.drop(['Cabin', 'Ticket', 'Name'], axis=1, inplace=True)
    
    # Encode categorical variables
    categorical_features = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
    encoder = OneHotEncoder(sparse_output=False)
    df_encoded = pd.DataFrame(encoder.fit_transform(df[categorical_features]))
    df_encoded.columns = encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features)
    df = pd.concat([df.drop(columns=categorical_features), df_encoded], axis=1)
    
    return df

train = preprocess_data(train)
test = preprocess_data(test)

# Split data into features and target
X = train.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y = train['Survived']

# Standardize the features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test.drop(columns=['PassengerId']))

# Define the SVM classifier with an RBF kernel
svm_classifier = SVC(kernel='rbf')

# Define the parameter grid for grid search
param_grid = {
    'C': [0.1, 1, 10, 100],
    'gamma': [1, 0.1, 0.01, 0.001],
    'kernel': ['rbf']
}

# Perform grid search with cross-validation
grid_search = GridSearchCV(svm_classifier, param_grid, cv=5, scoring='accuracy', n_jobs=-1)
grid_search.fit(X_scaled, y)

# Get the best estimator
best_svm = grid_search.best_estimator_

# Make predictions on test set

from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV

from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data

test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data

    # Fill missing values
    imputer_age = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
    imputer_embarked = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')
    df['Age'] = imputer_age.fit_transform(df[['Age']])
    df['Embarked'] = imputer_embarked.fit_transform(df[['Embarked']])

    df_encoded = pd.DataFrame(encoder.fit_transform(df[categorical_features]))
    df_encoded.columns = encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features)
    df = pd.concat([df.drop(columns=categorical_features), df_encoded], axis=1)
    
    return df

train = preprocess_data(train)
test = preprocess_data(test)

# Split data into features and target

# Standardize the features

X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)

# Define the parameter grid for grid search

}

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder, SimpleImputer
from sklearn.svm import SVC
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
def preprocess_data(df):
    # Fill missing values
    imputer_age = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
    imputer_embarked = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')
    df['Age'] = imputer_age.fit_transform(df[['Age']])
    df['Embarked'] = imputer_embarked.fit_transform(df[['Embarked']])
    
    # Drop unnecessary columns
    df.drop(['Cabin', 'Ticket', 'Name'], axis=1, inplace=True)
    
    # Encode categorical variables
    categorical_features = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
    encoder = OneHotEncoder(sparse_output=False)
    df_encoded = pd.DataFrame(encoder.fit_transform(df[categorical_features]))
    df_encoded.columns = encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features)
    df = pd.concat([df.drop(columns=categorical_features), df_encoded], axis=1)
    
    return df

train = preprocess_data(train)
test = preprocess_data(test)

# Split data into features and target
X = train.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y = train['Survived']

# Standardize the features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test.drop(columns=['PassengerId']))

# Define the SVM classifier with an RBF kernel
svm_classifier = SVC(kernel='rbf')

# Define the parameter grid for grid search
param_grid = {
    'C': [0.1, 1, 10, 100],
    'gamma': [1, 0.1, 0.01, 0.001],
    'kernel': ['rbf']
}

# Perform grid search with cross-validation
grid_search = GridSearchCV(svm_classifier, param_grid, cv=5, scoring='accuracy', n_jobs=-1)
grid_search.fit(X_scaled, y)

# Get the best estimator
best_svm = grid_search.best_estimator_

# Make predictions on test set

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder, SimpleImputer
from sklearn.svm import SVC
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
def preprocess_data(df):
    # Fill missing values
    imputer_age = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
    imputer_embarked = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')
    df['Age'] = imputer_age.fit_transform(df[['Age']])
    df['Embarked'] = imputer_embarked.fit_transform(df[['Embarked']])
    
    # Drop unnecessary columns
    df.drop(['Cabin', 'Ticket', 'Name'], axis=1, inplace=True)
    
    # Encode categorical variables
    categorical_features = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
    encoder = OneHotEncoder(sparse_output=False)
    df_encoded = pd.DataFrame(encoder.fit_transform(df[categorical_features]))
    df_encoded.columns = encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features)
    df = pd.concat([df.drop(columns=categorical_features), df_encoded], axis=1)
    
    return df

train = preprocess_data(train)
test = preprocess_data(test)

# Split data into features and target
X = train.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y = train['Survived']

# Standardize the features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test.drop(columns=['PassengerId']))

# Define the SVM classifier with an RBF kernel
svm_classifier = SVC(kernel='rbf')

# Define the parameter grid for grid search
param_grid = {
    'C': [0.1, 1, 10, 100],
    'gamma': [1, 0.1, 0.01, 0.001],
    'kernel': ['rbf']
}

# Perform grid search with cross-validation
grid_search = GridSearchCV(svm_classifier, param_grid, cv=5, scoring='accuracy', n_jobs=-1)
grid_search.fit(X_scaled, y)

# Get the best estimator
best_svm = grid_search.best_estimator_

# Make predictions on test set

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder, SimpleImputer
from sklearn.svm import SVC
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
def preprocess_data(df):
    # Fill missing values
    imputer_age = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
    imputer_embarked = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')
    df['Age'] = imputer_age.fit_transform(df[['Age']])
    df['Embarked'] = imputer_embarked.fit_transform(df[['Embarked']])
    
    # Drop unnecessary columns
    df.drop(['Cabin', 'Ticket', 'Name'], axis=1, inplace=True)
    
    # Encode categorical variables
    categorical_features = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
    encoder = OneHotEncoder(sparse_output=False)
    df_encoded = pd.DataFrame(encoder.fit_transform(df[categorical_features]))
    df_encoded.columns = encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features)
    df = pd.concat([df.drop(columns=categorical_features), df_encoded], axis=1)
    
    return df

train = preprocess_data(train)
test = preprocess_data(test)

# Split data into features and target
X = train.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y = train['Survived']

# Standardize the features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test.drop(columns=['PassengerId']))

# Define the SVM classifier with an RBF kernel

# Define the parameter grid for grid search
param_grid = {
    'C': [0.1, 1, 10, 100],
    'gamma': [1, 0.1, 0.01, 0.001],
    'kernel': ['rbf']
}

# Perform grid search with cross-validation

grid_search.fit(X_scaled, y)

# Get the best estimator
best_svm = grid_search.best_estimator_

# Make predictions on test set

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder, SimpleImputer
from sklearn.svm import SVC
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
def preprocess_data(df):
    # Fill missing values
    imputer_age = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
    imputer_embarked = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')
    df['Age'] = imputer_age.fit_transform(df[['Age']])
    df['Embarked'] = imputer_embarked.fit_transform(df[['Embarked']])
    
    # Drop unnecessary columns
    df.drop(['Cabin', 'Ticket', 'Name'], axis=1, inplace=True)
    
    # Encode categorical variables
    categorical_features = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
    encoder = OneHotEncoder(sparse_output=False)
    df_encoded = pd.DataFrame(encoder.fit_transform(df[categorical_features]))
    df_encoded.columns = encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features)
    df = pd.concat([df.drop(columns=categorical_features), df_encoded], axis=1)
    
    return df

train = preprocess_data(train)
test = preprocess_data(test)

# Split data into features and target

y = train['Survived']

# Standardize the features

X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test.drop(columns=['PassengerId']))

# Define the SVM classifier with an RBF kernel

# Define the parameter grid for grid search

    'C': [0.1, 1, 10, 100],
    'gamma': [1, 0.1, 0.01, 0.001],
    'kernel': ['rbf']
}

# Perform grid search with cross-validation

grid_search.fit(X_scaled, y)

# Get the best estimator

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split, GridSearchCV
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder, SimpleImputer
from sklearn.svm import SVC
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
def preprocess_data(df):
    # Fill missing values
    imputer_age = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
    imputer_embarked = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')
    df['Age'] = imputer_age.fit_transform(df[['Age']])
    df['Embarked'] = imputer_embarked.fit_transform(df[['Embarked']])
    
    # Drop unnecessary columns
    df.drop(['Cabin', 'Ticket', 'Name'], axis=1, inplace=True)
    
    # Encode categorical variables
    categorical_features = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
    encoder = OneHotEncoder(sparse_output=False)
    df_encoded = pd.DataFrame(encoder.fit_transform(df[categorical_features]))
    df_encoded.columns = encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features)
    df = pd.concat([df.drop(columns=categorical_features), df_encoded], axis=1)
    
    return df

train = preprocess_data(train)
test = preprocess_data(test)

# Split data into features and target
X = train.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y = train['Survived']

# Standardize the features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test.drop(columns=['PassengerId']))

# Define the SVM classifier with an RBF kernel
svm_classifier = SVC(kernel='rbf')

# Define the parameter grid for grid search
param_grid = {
    'C': [0.1, 1, 10, 100],
    'gamma': [1, 0.1, 0.01, 0.001],
    'kernel': ['rbf']
}

# Perform grid search with cross-validation
grid_search = GridSearchCV(svm_classifier, param_grid, cv=5, scoring='accuracy', n_jobs=-1)
grid_search.fit(X_scaled, y)

# Get the best estimator
best_svm = grid_search.best_estimator_

# Make predictions on test set
